intro: Paracarphalea kirondron, commonly known as the African bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy surface. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
